definitions.definition: A thing that has been reconstructed or restored to an earlier state.
The act of restoring something to an earlier state.
examples: The reconstruction of the medieval bridge began last year.

definitions.definition: The recreation or retelling of the (purported) events leading up to a certain outcome.
examples: The detective's reconstruction of what happened that night is dubious.

definitions.definition: A result of linguistic reconstruction ; a model representing an unattested linguistic unit : a phoneme , a morpheme or a word .

main_definition: A thing that has been reconstructed or restored to an earlier state.
secondary_definitions: The act of restoring something to an earlier state.
The recreation or retelling of the (purported) events leading up to a certain outcome.
( linguistics ) A result of linguistic reconstruction ; a model representing an unattested linguistic unit : a phoneme , a morpheme or a word .
